lesson_summary: Lesson on linear equations in one variable. Students learn how to solve simple equations, move terms, find common denominators, and check solutions. Requires basic arithmetic and logical reasoning.

groups.rationale: This group needs many concrete examples and step-by-step guidance. Focus on understanding the meaning of an equation.

slides.title: What is an equation?
slides.content: Introduce the concept of equations with real-life examples: balance, finding an unknown number. Use simple visuals and examples.

slides.title: How to move terms
slides.content: Explain the rule for moving terms with multiple examples. Emphasize changing the sign when moving across the equals sign.

slides.title: Worked examples
slides.content: 3-4 problems from simple to more complex, each step explained clearly.

quiz.question: The solution of x + 5 = 8 is?
quiz.hint: Move 5 to the right-hand side and change the sign

quiz.question: When moving a term across the equals sign, we should?

practice.hint: Move -3 to the right, change to +3

groups.rationale: This group has the basics but needs more varied practice to improve speed and accuracy.

slides.title: Quick review
slides.content: Summarize the basic steps for solving linear equations. Review moving terms and common denominators.

slides.title: Equations with fractions
slides.content: How to find common denominators and simplify. Tips for faster calculations.

slides.title: More complex equations
slides.content: Equations with parentheses, fractions, and terms on both sides.

groups.rationale: This group is strong on the basics and can explore advanced forms and real-world applications.

slides.title: Equations with absolute value
slides.content: Introduce absolute value and how to solve equations that include it.

slides.title: Equations with parameters
slides.content: Solve equations with a parameter. Discuss special cases.

slides.title: Real-world applications
slides.content: Applications in motion, mixture problems, and everyday contexts.

quiz.question: The equation mx = 6 has no solution when?

practice.problem: A car travels from A to B at speed x km/h for 3 hours. AB = 150 km. Find x.
